En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen,  como herrajes, cremalleras, etiquetas entre otros, para responder a la demanda de un mercado que se encuentra expandiéndose  y que él quiere abordar, para lograr cumplir sus expectativas de incremento de la producción, con los cuales ganará mas dinero y nuevos clientes, generando así mayores ingresos y con ello aumentaría su propio bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en: Bernardo, 33, lives in the capital of Colombia and 3 years ago started his entrepreneurial activity.  He makes handicrafts of metal, or out of loops, made with metal rings that he uses for reinforcement.  The material is usually steel that holds and attaches pieces or ornaments.   His work is very well done and he has been able to exhibit and sell the products to banks and to industrial organizations.  The main items that he makes are baskets, purses, packaging, zippers, etc.  He uses raw materials such as loops in many colors, and with them he weaves and makes beautiful baskets, clips, bags, etc.  His goal is to continue growing and broadening his market with new product lines.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan that he will use to buy the raw materials and items in greater volume, such as iron fittings, zippers, labels, etc, to sell to the expanding market. He wants to move on to succeed in fulfilling his plans of production growth that will help him earn more money and gain more customers.  All this will generate more income and that will improve his own life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and parts in greater volume such as iron fittings, zippers , labels, etc.

loans.name: Julia Amavilia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer de 45 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su víveres bazar y legumbres su historia empezó porque su esposo no tenía trabajo y quiso emprender un negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades, está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es seguir adelante con su negocio para seguir manteniendo a mis hijos que están pequeñitos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar víveres como legumbres, granos, enlatados y para bazar papeleria, plumas etc.
texts.en: Julia is a 45-year-old woman and she has many aspirations in the coming years of prospering with her business selling foodstuffs, stationery, and vegetables.  Her story began because her husband didn't have a job and she wanted to start a business.  She does her work alone and she has faced some challenges.  She is married; she has children; her most important dream is to move ahead with her business to continue to provide for her children, who are young.  That is why she wants this loan, to buy foodstuffs such as vegetables, grains, canned goods, and, for the stationery shop, paper goods, pens, etc.

loans.use: to buy paper goods, canned goods, drinks, candy

loans.name: Mushair

texts.en:
Mushair is 25 years old, single and living with his family. He put a lot of effort into finishing his secondary school education but could not go ahead to university due to the inaffordable high expenses related to studying. 
Like any youth, Mushair dreams of a better future and brighter world to surround him, but life in Yemen where he lives is full of challenges and difficulties. Mushair came to think that the only way to secure his future was to establish his own micro-enterprise. With the help of his family and some friends he was able to start a grocery business in his neighborhood.
Mushair took his first loan from Kiva partner AMB and successfully repaid all the installments when he started his business. This time, Mushair is taking his second loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grocery items and other goods required by his customers.
With the help of his grocery income, Mushair has been able to contribute to improving his family's living conditions. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and to save regularly for marriage.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.en:
Lizeth and Cinthy are sisters originally from Ecuador and are, respectively, the President and Vice-President of Chocobooth in South Florida. Chocobooth has been in operation for over eight years and has recently taken steps to becoming an incorporated business. The company provides a very unique photography service. Like conventional photography companies, Lizeth and Cindy take pictures for special events, birthdays, anniversaries, weddings, etc. and offer usual printing options. However, recently they have moved into printing photos on chocolate as well! This is a very unique service that is offered only at select companies. 
Both of these ladies also work second jobs to provide for themselves during the early stages of their company. Lizeth works full time for a university, while Cinthy works for UPS. 
This loan will be used to purchase a chocolography printing system. This technology will allow them to expand their business exponentially and offer their services to a wider clientele.

loans.use: to purchase a new chocolate printer (chocolography).

loans.name: Fawriah Group

texts.en:
This group is called FAWRIAH. It is made up of four women – Fawziah, Flstin, Nama and Fatima – who are neighbors from Aden, Yemen. They are hardworking women. They are taking a loan of 190,000 YER.
Fawziah is the group leader (she is the second woman from the right, with the blue handbag). She is 52 years old and married. She is a very efficient woman because, she says, aside from caring for her family, she likes to work and thus help her family. She has four adult children who are all studying. She hopes that all her children will be able to conclude their studies. 
Fawziah's business is selling clothes, which has been her sole source of income for over five years. She started her business selling articles of clothing in the market in her area with limited capital. She says that it is going very well, that her loan has helped her and that she is very satisfied with the support provided. 
At the present time, her business doesn't make more profit due to the difficult situation in Yemen. So she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc. to sell to customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve the income from her business. In the future, Fawziah would like to buy a house with stores in order to expand her business activity.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Nenelia

texts.en:
Nenelia is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

Nenelia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

Nenelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Rosario has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Rosario has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various food such as bananas, beans, potatoes, fanta, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Elecita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Elecita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина замужем, у нее двое детей. Валентина - фермер с большим стажем. Она занимается выращиваением овощей как на открытом грунте, так и в теплицах. Такая комбинация помогает ей всегда получать прибыль и не зависеть от колебаний цен на продукцию выращенную в теплицах или в открытом грунте.

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 13,000 гривен на закупку пленки, семян и системы полива для выращивания овощей в теплице. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и использовать ее для улучшения жилищных условий своей семьи.
texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two children.  She is a farmer with a great deal of experience.  She grows vegetables both in open fields and in greenhouses.  This combination helps her to always have a profit that isn't subject to fluctuations between the prices of produce grown in greenhouses or on open fields.

Valentina is aksing to be given a loan of 13,000 hryven to buy greenhouse film, seed, and a watering system for growing vegetables in a greenhouse.  She is hoping to earn extra profit and to use it to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to acquire greenhouse film, seed, and a watering system

loans.name: John Nduati

texts.en:
John is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 7. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for nine years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get a larger output and a nice house. In the background of the picture, other agriculture borrowers are looking on as the photo is being taken.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and cover labor costs.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

Pacita has rubber trees and corn fields.  She harvests and sells corn during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a of loan PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the rubber trees and corn fields.

Pacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rubber trees and corn fields.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 49 year old mother who is engaged in direct selling of AVON and PERSONAL collection products in her village to generate income. She has two school age children. Despite financial difficulties, she wants to continue sending her children to school because she wants them to earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to high cost of basic commodities and school fees, Elsa aims to improve her business to increase her income. She wants to ask for an additional capital of P8,000 to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, roll on, bags, shoes and jewelry to sell in her village. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will improve the business and makes it a viable and a profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body spray, underwear, roll on, bags, shoes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely is 31 years old. He is married to Rose and together they have three school going children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first term loan. He was brought to KADET LTD, by a KADET LTD staff. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of cooking fat, rice, sugar and flour for stock in his business.

He hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, rice, sugar and flour to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 56 years old and is married. She has been managing her hog raising business for almost three years. She describes herself as patient and industrious.

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps her provide for their daily needs. Now, she is requesting a loan of P 15,000(Philippine Pesos) to buy feed for raising her piglets. She wants to develop her business, to earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for raising her piglets.

loans.name: Vicenta Irene

texts.es: Vicenta es una mujer de 30 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio su historia empezó enmarcando los diplomas de sus hijos vio que podía tener esta actividad y sacar provecho así comenzó con este negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es poder ampliar su negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para mejorar el negocio comprando cemento, arena, pintura y asi darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Vicenta is a 30-year old woman who has great aspirations to grow her service in the coming years. Her story began when she framed her children's diplomas. She saw that she could have this trade and capitalize on it. So she started this business and works alone. She does not have any problems. She is not married and has children. Her most important dream is to expand her business. She would like the loan to improve her business by buying cement, sand, and paint so that she can offer her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and paint

loans.name: Petro

texts.ru:
Петр женат. Его супругу зовут Ольга. Петр имеет свой собственный бизнес.

В  родном селе Королево  у него есть кафе «Фламинго». Кафе расположено в центре села. Петр имеет одного сотрудника, а так же ему помогает жена. Занимается этим бизнесом он на протяжении 10 лет. Петр целеустремленный, предприимчивый, энергичный и трудолюбивый. Он также получает дополнительный доход, делая ремонтные работы. Бизнес цель Петра: открыть второе кафе, так как это направление ему нравится.

Петр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен, чтобы сделать легкий ремонт в кафе и увеличить оборотные средства. Это поможет Петру увеличить доход и еще на шаг приблизиться к его бизнес цели.
texts.en:
Petro is married and his wife is named Olga.  Petro has his own business.

He owns the Flamingo Cafe in his native village of Korolyovo.  The cafe is located in the center of the village.  Petro has one employee, and his wife helps him as well.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  Petro is goal-oriented, enterprising, energetic, and hardworking.  He also earns a supplemental income by doing remodeling work.  Petro's business goal is to open a second cafe since he really likes this line of work.

Petro is asking to be given a loan of 15,000 hryven in order to do a cosmetic remodel of his cafe and to increase his working capital.  This will help Petro to increase his income and to make one more step towards his business goal.

loans.use: to remodel his cafe and increase his working capital

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean  is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jean  has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jean  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jean  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Zvaidakushinga Group

texts.en:
This is 49 year old Chenesai from Mutare. She is married with four children, all attending school. She also cares for four dependents.

Chenesai runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is too much competition. Chenesai has requested a loan of $300 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve standards of living of her family. In the future, Chenesai plans to have a much bigger clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
This is Joan, 38, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, an employee, and she is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Joan operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Joan hopes to grow her business into a restaurant in her area and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients needed to make her products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 41 years old and married with four children. She runs a kindergarten to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. To earn extra income she does maize farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more books and desks.

loans.use: To buy more books and desks

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 24 years old.  He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughter

loans.name: Andres Remberto

texts.es:
Andrés, quiere seguir trabajando con nuestra institución, por eso se ha decidido a obtener un nuevo préstamo con el objetivo de aumentar en sus ventas, comprara un aparato de soldadura eléctrica y un compresor eléctrico, esto le permitirá tener las herramientas necesarios para seguir trabando y aumentar en sus ingresos.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho porque pudo comprar algunos repuestos el cual son necesarios y surtió el negocio, los resultados fueron muy buenos y logro ayudarle a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Andrés wants to continue working with our institution.  To do so he has decided to get a new loan with the objective of increasing his sales.  He will buy an electric soldering machine and an electric compressor.  This will allow him to have the tools he needs to continue working and increasing his income.

He believes that the previous loan helped him a lot.  He was able to buy some replacement parts he needed and he stocked the business.  The results were very good.  He managed to help his family with the house expenses.

loans.use: to buy an electric soldering machine and an electric compressor.

loans.name: Andriy

texts.ru:
Андрей женат. Его супругу зовут Светлана. У них два сына. Андрей имеет  собственный бизнес. 

На центральном рынке города расположена его торговая точка. Он продает нижние белье, кепки, женские колготки и другие вещи на протяжении 13 лет. С недавних пор Андрей устроился на дополнительную работу, а жена помогает ему на рынке.  Большой ассортимент товары и низкие цены привлекают покупателей. Андрей целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. Его ближайшая цель - улучшить благосостояние семьи, сделать ремонт в доме. 

Андрей просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20000 гривен на оплату аренды и на закупку весеннего ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Andriy is married and his wife's name is Svetlana.  They have two sons.  Andriy has his own business.

His sales outlet is located in his city's central market.  He has been selling underwear, caps, pantyhose, and other things for 13 years.  Recently, Andriy found a supplemental job and his wife is helping him at the market.  Customers are attracted by their wide assortment of merchandise and low prices.  Andriy is goal-oriented and hardworking.  His immediate goal is to improve his family's well-being and to remodel their home.

Andriy is asking to be given a loan of 20,000 hryven to pay rent and to buy an assortment of spring merchandise.

loans.use: to pay rent and to buy spring merchandise

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 48 years old, married and has one child. She is married to Benjamin and they are both involved in a retail business. The couple had been operating their store for almost three years now and usually generate about PHP 3,000 each month. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell such as bread, eggs, and canned goods. This will help increase her sales and boost her profits.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as bread, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is patient and an optimist mother of four. She is patiently generating a minimal income from her sari-sari (variety) store, but is still determined to pursue it. Merlito, her spouse, is her partner in the business. She revolves her daily profit and part of it goes for meals and allowances of her children. She needs to improve her sales, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits and bread to sell in her store. This additional merchandise will help increase her sales capacity and therefore increase her income too.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits and breads to sell

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 50 years old, married and has three children attending to school. He repairs bicycles. He had been in the business for 10 years now. This serves as his source of income. He had insufficient funds to maintain the business, which is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tires and oil to use in the repair business. 

Someday, he would like to keep earning good profits from the business and continue extending a helping hand to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil to use in the repair business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a responsible father who has raised his family in a village. He is 58 years old and has seven grown up children. Being a hard working father, he has educated his children, and most of them have become professionals. Despite of this, Benjamin has aimed to increase his income to satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies. 

To generate additional income, Benjamin has often used his motorcycle as transport to earn income. He is requesting a loan of PHP6,000 to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts for maintenance of his motorcycle for transport. He believes that his patience and hard work will enable him to make  improvements in his business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts for motorcycle transport

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y siembra de granos básicos, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, él es una persona humilde de mucho trabajo, sus actividades requieren dedicación iniciando desde las 5:00am hasta que logra salir con todas las labores que demanda, el aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaha horra, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la ganadería, tambien le dará otro aporte más en leche, lo que le permite mejorar los ingresos.
El sueña con tener más ganado en su terreno, pero que sea de calidad, tambien quiere que este esfuerzo sea para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José raises livestock and plants basic grains. He lives with his family and has a 4-year-old and an 8-year-old child. He is a humble person who has much work to do. His tasks require commitment from 5:00am until he manages to finish all the work demanded. He learned from his father.

Now he is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. This purchase would help him increase his stock. It also will provide him with another benefit, milk, which would allow him to increase his income. He dreams of having more livestock on his land, but it must be of good quality. He also wishes that this effort will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nidia Yaneth

texts.es:
Nidia, es madre de dos jóvenes de 15 y 13 años de edad, ella se dedica a atender labores agropecuarias, y tambien trabaja como administradora de un mercado, ella por crecer en una zona rural inicio sus quehaceres con la crianza de ganado, la cual la heredo de sus padres, tiene 15 años en la actividad y ha logrado manejar bien este oficio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de 9 quintales de comida para ganado y 20 de harinilla, además de vitaminas y desparasitantes, esta compra le ayudara para mantener lo necesario en alimentación para el ganado, y el cuido que necesiten.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio de ganado más rentable, poder a través de su desarrollo mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nidia is the mother of two young people, 13 and 15 years old. She does agricultural work, and she also works as an administrator of a market. Because she grew up in a rural area, she started her work by raising cattle, which she inherited from her parents. She has been doing this work for 15 years and she has succeeded in managing it well.

She is asking for a loan to purchase 9 100-pound bags of cattle feed and 20 100-pound bags of harinilla (wheat middlings), as well as vitamins and deparasite treatments. This purchase will help her maintain the necessary nutrition and care that the cattle need.

Her goal is to have a more profitable cattle business, and through its development be able to improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 9 100-pound bags of cattle feed and 20 100-pound bags of harinilla (wheat middlings)

loans.name: Marena

texts.en:
Marena is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Marena is providing motorcycle with sidecar transportation with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the motorcycle.

Marena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa works hard to provide sustenance for her family. She had been selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village for almost 10 years now. Though she only generates a minimal income from her business, Tomasa is still proud of this simple business she operates. She would like to improve her sales but it requires additional products to sell. For this reason, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy potatoes, cabbages, eggs and tomatoes to sell. Tomasa wanted to extend affordable price merchandise and a friendly service to her customers. From this time on, Tomasa will maintain a good income from her business, which will lead her to be financially stable someday.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbages, eggs and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Delinda Del Carmen

texts.es: Delinda es una mujer de 53 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su ventas de producto por catalogo su historia empezó hace 5 años atrás ella se quedo sin empleo ella trabajaba lavando ropa en eso días una amiga le conto que vendiendo estos productos podía salir adelante y ella le hizo caso, su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es terminar de construir su casa es un solo ambiente le gustaría construir un cuarto para ella y otro para su hijo y así vivir mas cómoda. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su ventas de productos por catalogo y asi comprar perfumes, cremas, shampoo.
texts.en: Delinda is 53 and has many aspirations for the coming years for her business selling catalogue products to prosper. Her story started 5 years ago when she was out of work. She worked washing clothes in those days. A friend told her that by selling these products, she could move forward, and she listened to her. She does her work alone and has no difficulties. She is not married. She has children. Her biggest dream is to finish building her house, which is only one room. She would like to build a room for herself and another for her child, in order to live more comfortably. For this, she wants the loan for her business selling catalogue products, in order to buy perfumes, creams, and shampoo.

loans.use: to acquire merchandise, perfumes, creams, and shampoo

loans.name: Joffre Eloy

texts.es: Joffre es un hombre de 34 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de víveres su historia empezó a vender frutas en la ciudad de Portoviejo, pero tuvo la oportunidad de comprarle una tienda a su hermana hace 2 años empezó con poco capital pero tuvo la oportunidad pero con el pasar del tiempo ha ido incrementando su negocio, su trabajo lo hace con su esposa, no tiene dificultades, está casado, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener un local grande y muy estable con puertas adecuadas y bien surtido y también seguir estudiando y en lo familiar desea darle un buena educación a sus hijos y seguir adelante con su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de víveres.
texts.en: Joffre, 34, has many hopes of prosperity in the new few years.   His story begins with fruit sales in Portoviejo but he had the opportunity of buying a store from his sister 2 years ago.  He started with little capital but with time he has increased his business.   He works with his wife and doesn't have problems.  He is married, has children, and his biggest dream is to be the owner of a large, well-stocked and stable store with enough entrances,  and to continue studying.  He wants to give his children a good education and continue getting ahead so that his family's living standards improve.

loans.use: to add merchandise, rice, oil, sweets

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Mary Jean has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mary Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mary Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Delma has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Delma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer de 55 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó hace 2 años con ayuda de hermanos que están en el extranjero, su trabajo lo hace con su hija, no tiene dificultades, es viuda, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es desea incrementar negocio hacer mas surtida la tienda para poderse ayudar en el futuro. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y asi comprar  arroz, aceite, etc.
texts.en: Hilda is 55 years old and has many aspirations for her store to prosper in the coming years. Her story began 2 years ago with the help of brothers who live abroad. She does her work with her daughter and has no difficulties. She is a widow and has children. Her biggest dream is that she wants to increase her business, stocking more items in the store in order to be able to help in the future. That is why she wants the loan for her store to buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store such as rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia, quiere seguir trabajando con un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere continuar aumentando en sus ventas, y porque es la época de la temporada escolar y comprara stiker, pulseras, cds, cuadernos y otros productos para su venta, ya que esto le permitirá tener más disponibilidad para crecer en su inventario.
Ella considera que el crédito anterior le dio resultado positivo, porque invirtió todo el préstamo en su negocio y mejoro mucho su calidad de vida para ella y sus familia.
texts.en:
Claudia wants to keep working with a new loan, because she wants to continue increasing her sales, and because it is school season. She will buy stickers, bracelets, CDs, notebooks, and other products to sell, since this will allow her to have more availability to increase her inventory.

She thinks the previous loan gave her positive results, because she invested the entire loan in her business, and the quality of life for herself and her family improved a lot.

loans.use: to buy stickers, bracelets, CDs, and notebooks

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es:
Patrocinia, se ha decidido a obtener otro crédito con el propósito de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de ropa, en el cual vende camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, ropa interior y teniendo variedad lograra vender más con este prestamo realizara la inversion en todas las prendas que demanda.
Ella menciona que el préstamo anterior le ayudo porque logro surtir mas y aumento en clientes, el cual le ayudo porque los ingresos fueron muy buenos y pudo ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: Patrocinia has decided to obtain another loan with the goal of continuing to invest in her clothing business. She sells shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and underwear. By having variety she will succeed in selling more with this loan. She will invest in all the garments that are in demand. She says that the previous loan helped her because she succeeded in increasing her stock and customers, which helped her because the earnings were very good and she was able to help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and underwear

loans.name: Rochelyn

texts.en:
Rochelyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Rochelyn has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rochelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rochelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Isabelita has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Isabelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Isabelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Emily has a retail business, selling canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Ligaya has a retail business, selling canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ligaya has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ligaya hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is 25 years old, married and has 3 children. She runs a beauty salon to earn her living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. 

To earn extra income Mable sells second-hand clothes. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mable has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair dryer and a hair blow dry machine.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a hair blow dry machine.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 3 children. 

Annabelle has a retail shop, selling canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 25 year old single woman. She has a daughter who is 4 years old. She describes herself to be industrious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are men and ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to expand her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. Rose's business goal is to have a stable income so as to support her daughter, as a single mother, within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Maria Hazel

texts.en:
Maria Hazel  is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Maria Hazel has a retail shop in the school canteen where she buys & sells candies, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP15,000 to buy stocks of candies, snacks & beverages.

Maria Hazel  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Maria Hazel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Renilda has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000PHP to buy vegetables, candies & snacks to sell.

Renilda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Renilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, candies & snacks to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Rita has a retail shop that buys & sells to buy candies, cookies & snacks. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP16,000 to buy candies, cookies & snacks to sell.

Rita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, cookies & snacks to sell.

loans.name: Apolonia Margarita

texts.es: Apolonia es una mujer de 47 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de almuerzos su historia empezó hace 7 años decidió cocina almuerzo para entregar en urbanizaciones a los albañiles le fue bien y desde entonces se dedico a esta actividad, su trabajo lo hace con un ayudante, tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es comprar un carro. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para la venta de almuerzos comprando asi carnes, vegetales, verduras, aliños.
texts.en: Apolonia is 47 years old and she has many aspirations for the coming years to prosper in her business of selling lunches. Her story starts 7 years ago. She decided to cook lunches for bricklayers in the developments. It went well for her, and since then she has been working in this business. She does her work with an assistant. She has some difficulties. She is not married and she has children. Her most important dream is to buy a car. She wants the loan for the lunches, so that she can buy meats, vegetables, greens, and seasonings.

loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, greens, and seasonings.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is engaged. He has been a rice farmer for 2 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. Behind him in the picture, other agriculture borrowers are shown sitting down, waiting for their turn to get photos too. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and to support labor costs .

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Maricar has a retail shop from which she buys & sells food seasonings & dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000PHP to buy stock of food seasonings & dried fish.

Maricar has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food seasonings & dried fish.

loans.name: Niva

texts.en:
Niva is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 3 years of age. She describes herself to be customer friendly and quiet. 

Niva operates a water retail stall where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation of water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another water outlet for selling water to customers. Niva's  business goal and dream is to run many more water outlets within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will venture into the hotel business and to own a hotel.

loans.use: to buy another water outlet for selling water to customers.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 30 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 6 years old. He sells items in a boutique (body lotion, cooking oil, soap and so on). Francois has five years of experience and employs two people to help him.

Francois has requested a loan from Kiva loans vision finance company in order to expand his business. He will be buying more quantities of body lotion, cooking oil, soap and so on, to sell. With the profit from this loan, Francois will be able to increase his business and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase more general store items, like body lotion, soap, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Elizer

texts.en:
Elizer is 36 years old and still single. He lives with in a village with his beloved parents. His ambition in life is to become financially stable before he is going to settle down. To generate income, Elizer has been engaged in the hog-raising business for almost 3 years. He usually earns a profit of 10,000PHP a month that he usually spends for their necessities and to support the education of his younger brother and sisters. 

Elizer planned to improve his pigpen and to raise more pigs for sale but, due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP6,000 to buy feed, vitamins, materials and additional piglets to raise. He is hoping that the loan will help a lot to make improvements in his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, materials and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Lesly Yalila

texts.es: La  Señora Lesly, viven en la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedicada a su negocio de Elaboración y venta de tortillas, desde hace mas de diez años, comenzó desde pequeña cuando le ayudaba a su mama, le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que gracias a este negocio ha logrado mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera, con mucho esfuerzo los tiene estudiando y sueño es poder llegar a graduarlos y que tengan las oportunidades que ella no puedo tener, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 12,000.00  para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, y productos para la venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
Lesly lives in the city of Choluteca.  She has had a business of making and selling tortillas for over ten years.  She started when she was young and helped her mother.  She really likes what she does.

Thanks to this business she has managed to support her two children; she is a single mother.  With a lot of effort she has them going to school.  Her dream is to be able to have them graduate and have the opportunities that she was not able to have.  She lives with her parents and siblings.

She is requesting a loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, and products to sell sweets.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, and and other items for her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 52 years old and blessed with two children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through vegetable production and sales. She earns about PHP250 each week doing this type of business. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs sufficiently and to save for the future of her children. 

At this time, she has planted more vegetables expecting to increase her production next season, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP25,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Anyango is a 28 year old food stall owner in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is single and has been doing this business for the last three years. Her business is doing great.

Her monthly income from the business is twenty thousand shillings. She was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this makes her first loan. 

She plans to use the loan to construct a bigger, more spacious food stall. The anticipated profits will be used to further expand her business and she hopes to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to construct a bigger and spacious food stall.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a business woman, and a mother of two children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.
